meanings.def: to put a drug or other substance into a person’s or an animal’s body using a syringe
examples: inject something (into yourself/somebody/something) Adrenaline was injected into the muscle.
inject (yourself/somebody/something) (with something) She has been injecting herself with insulin since the age of 16.
The animals were injected with small amounts of the chemical.
She's a former heroin addict who, six months after she stopped injecting, is getting her life back together.

meanings.def: to put a liquid or other substance into something using a syringe or similar instrument
examples: inject A (with B) The fruit is injected with chemicals to reduce decay.
inject B (into A) Chemicals are injected into the fruit to reduce decay.
Foam is injected into the walls where it expands and provides insulation.

meanings.def: to add a particular quality to something
examples: His comments injected a note of humour into the proceedings.
They are hoping a change of leader will inject new energy into the movement.
trying to inject some new life into their marriage

meanings.def: to give money to an organization, a project, etc. so that it can function
examples: They are refusing to inject any more capital into the industry.
